div.a: How An All-Star Team Put An End To The Deepwater Horizon Spill

div.div: When the Deepwater Horizon drilling platform in the Gulf of Mexico exploded on April 20, 2010, 11 workers tragically lost their lives and the Macondo well began gushing crude oilâ€”and it would continue to do so for nearly three months. A parade of attempts to shut down the flow taught the public just how difficult it was to tame a wild well 5,000 feet beneath the surface of the sea.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ViaKnX&via=Digg&text=How An All-Star Team Put An End To The Deepwater Horizon Spill
